meanings.definition: A person who tests or demonstrates the truth or validity of something.
meanings.sent1: The proofers carefully checked the experiment results.
meanings.sent2: The proofers at the lab ensured the data was accurate.
meanings.sent3: The proofers found out the secret ingredient in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: She was the proofer of all rumors in the town.
meanings.sent5: The proofers uncovered the hidden treasure in the old map.

meanings.definition: A substance used to make dough rise.
meanings.sent1: The baker added the proofers to the dough to make it fluffy.
meanings.sent2: Yeast is a common proofer in bread making.
meanings.sent3: The proofers made the dough dance in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The magic proofer turned the flat dough into a delicious loaf.
meanings.sent5: The proofers worked their magic, transforming the dough into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A device used to test the accuracy of a thermometer.
meanings.sent1: The proofer showed that the thermometer was working correctly.
meanings.sent2: The technician used the proofer to calibrate the thermometer.
meanings.sent3: The proofer played a tune when the thermometer was accurate.
meanings.sent4: The proofer whispered the temperature secrets to the thermometer.
meanings.sent5: The proofer beeped happily as the thermometer passed the test.
